name: Ibis Sydney King Street Wharf

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Although I have no complaints about the service of this hotel, I was taken aback when I arrived to be informed that I would be charged 150 $A on top of my bill as a "holding" charge! This info wasn't on their site, and this amount was supposed to be reimbursed to my account sometime later...They also charge for paying by credit card, so check out other places first!
reviews.title: Be warned!

reviews.text: Staff very friendly and helpful, clean and easy to access and park (once directions known from front desk). Room ridiculously small, bed uncomfortable and too small. I'm 6'2" admitedly, but my wife is only 5'2" and she struggled with her feet hanging off the end. The TV mounted on an angle that faces the window, not the bed, and cannot be adjusted. Soft mesh blind on window bangs against the frame when the air conditioning is on (keeping you awake), which is all the time because you cant adjust the fan speed or open the window. For the money, have stayed at a lot of better valued (appointed/sized) hotels in Sydney.
reviews.title: Poor accommodation if more than 4ft tall

reviews.text: I spent two nights here after flying in from overseas. I was on the 5th floor of the building, it only has 7 floors. I am unsure if there are harbour views, most of the windows would be facing the city.
reviews.title: Small Rooms, Bit noisy but great location.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We booked the hotel for one night for a dinner in the city. The rooms are the smallest rooms I have ever seen, there is no way of walking around the room with someone else there. When either my wife or I needed to maove around, one had to sit on the bed.
reviews.title: Definately worth looking elsewhere

reviews.text: Our room was right next to the freeway and despite the double glazing on the windows it is very noisy. To cap it all off, the TV didn't work and the air conditioning was also off. When we checked out, we were told that the air conditioning units were old and frequently broke down.
reviews.title: Small room, expensive, but well located

reviews.text: That was information the clerk should have kept to himself, no offer of any credit/meal/refund, would not have satyed there again anyway.
reviews.title: Dissapointed

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I don't care if the small room and noisy location was something (a) I didn't care about or (b) the price reflected it. For what we were charged, neither should have been an issue. A real dissapointment.
reviews.title: Great location, even if hard to find
Great location
reviews.text: Went to Sydney for a 50th birthday party, part of which was a boat cruise leaving from the King Street Wharf. I booked this hotel for the proximity to the Wharf (and Cockle Bay), and because I am a ClubAccor member. The room was small but well arranged. The hotel is obviously a budget establishment. I have stayed at a number of Ibis hotels in Europe of similar standard for $100 per night. I still can't work out why this one cost $325 per night - or why I was stupid enough to book it at that price. I could have got the Westin for not that much more, and there is no comparison. Perhaps there as a lot going on in Sydney that weekend - but that's still no excuse for either me or the hotel.
I stayed here for two nights while i was on a holiday in SYD. This place has the best location and just in the heart of everything. Most places were walking distance and good choice of food near by.
reviews.title: Best location!!

reviews.text: The rooms were new but small and tight. Very clean and modern style bathroom with all facilities. Parking was expensive for the night about $40/night so not a good idea if your renting a car to drive around Sydney.
reviews.title: Disappointing hotel

reviews.text: A group (6) of us stayed here 6-8 Sep. 2012. We were in Sydney for work and were booked in by the office - all in separate rooms. Rooms are tiny. My bed and pillows were acceptable, although the bed was short - I'm 185cm and my feet hung over the end of the bed. Others complained the beds were uncomfortable and one complained of a weak shower (not a problem in my room). Shower is tiny. All of us found the hotel noisy, some rooms worse than others. The hotel abuts a flyover (and I mean abuts - cars were less than 3m from the room in one case). I wasn't troubled until about 5.30 am whilst others found the noise disturbing. The windows are double glazed so it is luck of the draw. The hotel is cheap, but none of us would stay here again. Breakfast cost $22 (less 15% discount voucher the provide) and was okay, but not as extensive as most hotels. We paid $155 per night.
reviews.title: Fab Location For Sydney
Nice place to unwind - it's near the water.
reviews.text: I had an overnight stay in Sydney and the Ibis was around the corner from work. The location was excellent not only for the convenience to the office but the fact it's situated a short stroll from Darling Harbour; this is a nice place for an early morning walk.
The room its self was small but very clean and well fitted; it was fine a for night or two.
reviews.title: A schmick cosy room

aka: Ibis Sydney King Street Wharf Hotel Sydney
description: Opened Dec 2008, boasting fresh, modern design, complete with an LCD TV, in room safe, free paytv (Foxtel) broadband and WiFi Internet access, a mini fridge and tea and coffee making facilities. Ideal location in the heart of Sydney.
